Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately illustrate the difference between a plant that has enough water and a plant that does not, showing vivid contrasts in health and appearance.
The student can draw the effects of water on plants, such as lush leaves and upright stems for hydrated plants, and wilting leaves and drooping stems for dehydrated ones.
The student can include evidence that plants need water to live and grow, incorporating signs of plant health and decline comprehensively.
The student can identify and represent patterns in their drawings, such as illustrating time progression from healthy to wilting if water is not provided.
CANNOT: Minor details such as labeling every type of plant or root system might be incomplete (student focuses more on health contrast rather than botanical specifics).
The student may not consistently represent environmental factors like sunlight or soil composition, focusing mainly on water as the key variable.
